destinations.name: Anything But Ordinary
destinations.description: Please welcome a NEW arts walk destination to our event featuring the art of Dane Eisenbart.

destinations.name: The Arc Office
destinations.description: Kyle Ashbaugh has attended The Arc's ArtFocus program since 2007. His imaginative work is now being featured in the InSight Gallery.

destinations.name: Art in the Valley
destinations.description:
Russ was trained as an electrical engineer and started his career with Southern Cal Edison Power Company. He shortly realized that this would not be his life's work, and was soon hired as a physics professor with the LA Community College system. After 27 years teaching, Russ retired, moved to Corvallis and worked as an artistic blacksmith, creating drawer pulls, drapery rods and other ironwork art. 

In 1986 Russ discovered Vistas and Vineyards and was soon doing pen and pencil drawings. Russ tried watercolor, and has found his passion in oil painting. He has served 11 years as artist in residence at Tumacacori National Historical Park in southern Arizona.

destinations.name: The Arts Center
destinations.description: TAC will host a reception for artists from IMAGINE exhibit, Wes Cropper, Jim Hockenhull and Lorraine Richey. They are showing prints made with digital tools in very different processes, and consequently with different feel in the work.  They are –still- presenting limited prints, traditionally framed and presented in the same manner as intaglio prints and serigraphs historically have been.

destinations.name: ArtWorks (CEI) Gallery
destinations.description: Francisco Morales  Serie de Expansi`on ArtWorks (CEI) Gallery June 16-july 11 408 SW Monroe Ave, Suite 110  More info: bruce@cieworks.org

destinations.name: Azure Fine Art Gallery
destinations.summary: At the Heat of it All
destinations.description: Batik & encaustic artist Shari Carlson breaks the rules of tradition to achieve vibrant colors, minute details & flowing lines culminating in a story that will touch you.  Every animal has a story and each batik and encaustic sculpture includes the narrative of her experience with it.

destinations.name: Brittney West
destinations.description: View Britt's new artwork created at an art retreat at Shotpouch Creek Cabin inspired by the land and wildlife, including works painted with grass, moss and horsetail. See vintage material created into mixed media paintings featuring lush overgrowth!

destinations.name: Corvallis Multicultural Literacy Center
destinations.description: WEARING THE WORLD, 2016 - a multicultural textile exhibit at the Corvallis Multicultural Literacy Center.  Come and get inspired - see a collection of colorful clothing and intricate textiles gathered from around the globe, both vintage and contemporary.  Many hand sewn, hand dyed and embroidered pieces demonstrating a wealth of traditions and techniques, from ceremonial to utilitarian.  The exhibit features pieces from 20 countries, and is enhanced by a continuously running slide show.  Information on the pieces was created for the show by a world-wide, on-line volunteer research program.   The exhibit is curated by CMLC volunteer textile archivist and OSU graduate Ivy She, and was sponsored in part by the Benton County Cultural Coalition.  Exhibit runs through May 31.  Opening 4:00pm – 8:00pm, with a reception and live music from 6:00pm – 8:00pm

destinations.name: Corvallis Swing
destinations.summary: Swing dancing at Old World Deli
destinations.description:
We will be dancing on stage at the Old World Deli as part of the monthly Corvallis Arts Walk!! 

Our time will be short but sweet. Let's dance and celebrate together!!

destinations.name: Corvidopolis
destinations.summary: FALL FUNGUS FIESTA - Visit the CORVIDOPOLIS Studio, view & color some new mushroom prints, draw your favorite fungus and talk fall foraging.

destinations.name: Cyrano's
destinations.description: Cyrano's, taking on favorite games and transforming them into …. books, jewelry, prints,  and sculptures.  Come in and throw the dice or  spin the wheel to see what you might win!

destinations.name: Fairbanks Art Gallery
destinations.description: A diversity of styles and approaches to art, with faculty members working in the areas of photography, painting, drawing, mixed media, printmaking, installation & video. Evan Baden, Michael Boonstra, Julia Bradshaw, Kay Campbell, Anna Fidler, Julie Green, Stephen Hayes, Yuji Hiratsuka, Shelley Jordon, Andy Myers, John Whitten and Kerry Skarbakka are included in this exhibit. Fairbanks Gallery is located in Fairbanks Hall, at the corner of SW Jefferson Way and 26th Street on the OSU campus.  Gallery hours are 8am-5pm, Monday through Friday. The exhibit closes after the closing reception on September 28.

destinations.name: Footwise Storefront Window
destinations.description: For the Window on Art project, Madelaine Corbin's SHOWROOM IV project explores the notion of display and the perceived public and private worlds displays exist in. The two spheres of the public and the private, and the space between the two, is intensely curated, altered, and disguised. Objects are used as items on display to describe, suggest, or project a lifestyle or an identity. Instead of looking at the objects however, SHOWROOM IV examines the hidden and constructed lifestyle by placing that very life on display. What happens when a private life is placed in a public context?

destinations.name: Foundry Annex
destinations.description:
Ugly Art Room will present a solo show featuring the anatomical stitchings of NYC-based artist, Hannah Lamar Koelbl.

Hannah has been embroidering photographs, newspaper, and wax papers since 2007.

In 2012 she began a Master’s Program in Occupational Therapy and completed a gross anatomy dissection, an experience which inspired the recreation of illustrations from her textbook, Netter’s Anatomy, in drawing and embroidery.

Based on an aesthetic preference, she has chosen to work with the female reproductive anatomy in particular, and to explore the many textural & visual layers, as well as the associations we draw upon.

destinations.name: Jeff Hess Studio
destinations.description: Feature exhibit - A selection of eclectic landscape oil paintings & quirky block printed work by local artist Beth Barnett.   Some new work by Jeff Hess on display as well.

destinations.name: Kaleidoscope Studios
destinations.description: Kaleidoscope Studio will have mazes puzzles games hide and seek fun creative exercises and challenges throughout the month and during the Art Walk

destinations.name: Karen Wysopal Studio
destinations.description: Colorful works in alcohol ink and acrylic. Stop by to see Karen's first 5-ft by 7-ft alcohol ink painting. New works in alcohol ink and acrylic texture studies on display and for sale.  Sign up for an alcohol ink painting workshop!

destinations.name: Living Room Gallery
destinations.description: Drawings by the accomplished local artist Alice Marshall

destinations.name: Majestic Theatre
destinations.description: Take a walk through Wonderland and explore new and original works inspired by the literary classics, Alice in Wonderland and Through the Looking Glass. Wonderland engages the imagination through new interpretations of the much loved story and kicks off two months of Alice in Wonderland themed events in celebration of our upcoming production.

destinations.name: OSU Center for the Humanities
destinations.summary: Views of the Columbia Coast. Six photographers share their unique perspectives of the Lower Columbia, from Astoria to Oysterville. Drop-in photo editing demos and advice, 5-7pm.
destinations.description:
Views of the Columbia Coast

A multi-faceted portrait of one of the Northwest's most significant historical regions presented by six local photographers: Rich Bergeman, Allan Doerksen, Dave McIntire, Kurt Norlin, John Ritchie and Dan Wise.

More than 30 color and b+w photographs explore the Lower Columbia Region, from Astoria's historic waterfront and the upriver Brownsmead sloughs, to the mysterious Fort Columbia and the picturesque Washington towns of Ilwaco and Oysterville.

Reception with refreshments from 4-7pm; photo editing demos and advice from 5-7pm. You can also bring your questions to ask the experts as they demonstrate techniques from basic image adjustments to more advanced panorama stitching, composites, and HDR.  Bring your own photographs (on paper, thumb drive, pad or phone) for feedback.

destinations.name: Pegasus Gallery
destinations.description: Pegasus Gallery hosts the aesthetically stunning digital illustrations by K Lars Lohn as he bravely explores his creative process with contemporary tools and includes some embedded playfulness for the mind.  Art and play are inescapable companions in his work and the outcome of his process results in a beautiful, thought-provoking and surprisingly satisfying visual experience. Kaleidoscope Studios, Cyrano's and the Old World Deli will be joining Pegasus to explore Art and Play with games, mazes, puzzles, mysteries throughout the month and some nifty creative challenges during the CAW.

destinations.name: PopTart
destinations.description: Poptart & Ugly Art Room present an anti Valentine's Day group art show along with $25 tattoos, a photo booth, snacks & libations by Corvallis Brewing Supply. Check out uglyartroom.com for artist information.

destinations.name: The Rabbit Hole
destinations.description:
Featuring Rachel's small paintings from  "When Mirrors Chase Sky" Series. Stroll in and view small paintings packed full of intense color, expressive line work and writing.

Experience these small abstract paintings up close and personal as the pieces are paired with poems and notes from the artist.

The studio will also have original coloring books, prints and cards for sale.

destinations.name: Studio Beatrice
destinations.description:
Studio Beatrice features local watercolor artist Molly Perry, showing her landscapes, florals and local attractions.  The work of many artists in a salon setting.  Marshall Adams adds music, Kathi brings libations from Spindrift Cellars.

Studio Beatrice is also open Fridays 11-2 and by appointment
 beatrice.artwork@gmail.com

destinations.name: Studio262
destinations.description: Local artist and Studio262 owner, Jennifer Lommers, is bringing back her NeverEnding Story series of 128 blocks of little art forming one large tree to be completed over the duration of the show, June 7 - July 27. Come watch her progress as she demonstrates during the Arts Walk!

destinations.name: Teal Cooperative Gallery
destinations.summary: Come watch Harry McManus demonstrate wood turning. Featuring local handcrafted sweets by Melarova Baking and ginger liqueur by Spiritopia.

destinations.name: Voices Gallery
destinations.description: June brings blue into focus at Voices Gallery.  Blue in the sky, blue in the water.  Blue jays...blue bonnets...blue eye...blue jeans - Come to Voices in June and make the Blue Scene.  Voices is a 7 member galley on the third floor of Madison Square.
